alert.note: Alert for Simcoe Highlands (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Pendleton (Northeast Oregon and Southeast Washington)
info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 01 at 7:59PM PST until January 03 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Pendleton
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 4 PM SUNDAY TO 4 PM PST MONDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 10 inches. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. * WHERE...Simcoe Highlands. * WHEN...From 4 PM Sunday to 4 PM PST Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Patchy to areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Light snow will begin by Sunday evening and gradually become heavier overnight. This combined with gusty winds will cause blowing snow and poor visibility for travelers.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1, or by visiting online at https://tripcheck.com for Oregon or https://wsdot.com/travel for Washington.
